snippet: Stuart Frank, a curator at the New Bedford Whaling Museum, has written a book detailing the scrimshaw carvings of sailors on 19th-century whale ships.
abstract: Eve M Kahn Antiques column; curator Stuart Frank has written book Ingenious Contrivances, Curiously Carved: Scrimshaw in the New Bedford Whaling Museum; Shirley M Mueller, collector of Chinese export porcelain, is gathering data about how some 18th-century china acquired markings falsely suggesting that it belonged to American Revolutionary War heroes; Sotheby's will auction 20 pieces from Gothic Revival antiques collection of Lee B Anderson.
lead_paragraph: Stuart Frank, a curator at the New Bedford Whaling Museum, has written a book detailing the scrimshaw carvings of sailors on 19th-century whale ships.

headline.seo: Scrimshaw in New Book From New Bedford Whaling Museum
